title: Keycloak Provider test service don't allow using url with CAPS character
body:
### Describe the bug

When trying to test an URL secure with a Keycloak launched via the Quarkus Dev service, i can't target the right path. 

The path i need to called is `/Patient` but the dev ui call the url `/patient` in lowercase. This fail with a 404 error. Capitals letters in URL is a valid format so no modification should be apply. I can't update my URL because i need to follow FHIR specifications that defines resources with capitals letters.

### Expected behavior

Allow using URL with capital character like `/Patient` and use it with no modification to call the endpoint.

### Actual behavior

Url is transformed to lowercase. After digged in inside code at `https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/main/extensions/oidc/deployment/src/main/resources/dev-ui/qwc-oidc-provider.js`, I found this line : `this._servicePath = (e.detail?.value || '').trim().toLowerCase();` at L783. I think removing the toLowerCase() method should fix this issue.

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer

Step to reproduce

1. Follow the tutorial at https://quarkus.io/guides/security-keycloak-authorization
2. Update a protected resource with a capital character
3. Test with DevUI

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Linux MCSWKS00966 6.2.0-26-generic #26~22.04.1-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Thu Jul 13 16:27:29 UTC 2 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17.0.8" 2023-07-18

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment Oracle GraalVM 17.0.7+8.1 (build 17.0.7+8-LTS-jvmci-23.0-b12)

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.3.1

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.9.4 

### Additional information

_No response_
